docs.lead_paragraph: Here’s what you need to know about the week’s top stories.

byline.original: By ANDREA KANNAPELL and SANDRA STEVENSON

docs.snippet: Here’s what you need to know about the week’s top stories....

headline.main: Your Weekend Briefing: Climate Talks, Donald Trump, Dupont

keywords.value: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama declared victory at home in his quest for an ambitious climate agreement, six years after a climate pact in Copenhagen left many disappointed.
docs.snippet: President Obama declared victory at home in his quest for an ambitious climate agreement, six years after a climate pact in Copenhagen left many disappointed....
docs.abstract: Pres Obama's success at steering world leaders towards landmark climate agreement in Paris reflects fruits of hard-won diplomatic experience; second-term focus on fighting global warming is crucial addition to his legacy, alongside Affordable Care Act.

headline.print_headline: President, Once a Guest, Now a Leader in World Talks
headline.main: Obama, Once a Guest, Is Now a Leader in World Talks

docs.lead_paragraph: The poll suggests that the Texas senator’s campaign is gathering momentum and that there could be a long Republican nomination fight ahead.
docs.snippet: The poll suggests that the Texas senator’s campaign is gathering momentum and that there could be a long Republican nomination fight ahead....
docs.abstract: Iowa poll commissioned by Des Moines Register and Bloomberg Politics shows Sen Ted Cruz with 31% lead in state, followed by Donald Trump ten points behind; findings indicate potential for long nomination battle.

headline.print_headline: Cruz Soars Past Trump for Lead in Iowa Poll, Suggesting a Long Fight Ahead
headline.main: Ted Cruz Surges Past Donald Trump to Lead in Iowa Poll

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. President Barack Obama on Saturday hailed the landmark climate accord reached in Paris as strong and historic, calling it the best chance to save the planet from the effects of global climate change.
docs.snippet: U.S. President Barack Obama on Saturday hailed the landmark climate accord reached in Paris as strong and historic, calling it the best chance to save the planet from the effects of global climate change....

headline.print_headline: Obama Calls Paris Climate Pact 'Best Chance' to Save the Planet
headline.main: Obama Calls Paris Climate Pact 'Best Chance' to Save the Planet

docs.lead_paragraph: Speaker Paul D. Ryan said congressional Republicans must set a policy agenda that offered a clear contrast to the angry insurgent refrain blasting into the winter primaries.
docs.snippet: Speaker Paul D. Ryan said congressional Republicans must set a policy agenda that offered a clear contrast to the angry insurgent refrain blasting into the winter primaries....
docs.abstract: Republican House Speaker Paul D Ryan calls for spirit of inclusiveness in Congress, saying his party in particular must present sober alternative to candidates who prioritize personalty and independence over bipartisan unity; concedes that he will support eventual nominee.

headline.print_headline: Ryan Says ‘Inclusive’ House Agenda Must Counter Polarizing Campaign
headline.main: Paul Ryan Says ‘Inclusive’ House Agenda Must Counter Polarizing Campaign

docs.lead_paragraph: From business leaders to politicians, world figures reacted on Saturday to news that climate negotiators in Paris had approved a breakthrough accord that will for the first time unite rich and poor nations in combating climate change.
docs.snippet: From business leaders to politicians, world figures reacted on Saturday to news that climate negotiators in Paris had approved a breakthrough accord that will for the first time unite rich and poor nations in combating climate change....

headline.print_headline: Factbox: World Reacts to New Climate Accord
headline.main: Factbox: World Reacts to New Climate Accord

docs.lead_paragraph: In a renewed effort to attract younger women to her campaign, Hillary Clinton is now more intent on trying to forge common cause on specific issues, and less on merely shattering the glass ceiling.

byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK and YAMICHE ALCINDOR

docs.snippet: In a renewed effort to attract younger women to her campaign, Hillary Clinton is now more intent on trying to forge common cause on specific issues, and less on merely shattering the glass ceiling....
docs.abstract: Enthusiasm over prospect of Hillary Rodham Clinton becoming first female president is often split along generational lines, with older voters who experienced more sexist time responding more to idea than younger generation; strong likelihood of Clinton being nominee has prompted many women to consider how much gender should factor in their vote.

headline.print_headline: Historic Aspect of Clinton’s Bid Divides Women by Generation
headline.main: Moms and Daughters Debate Gender Factor in Hillary Clinton’s Bid

docs.lead_paragraph: Helping a friend accused of sexual offenses led to accusations of misconduct against the prominent lawyer Alan Dershowitz. Now he’s fighting to clear his name.
docs.snippet: Helping a friend accused of sexual offenses led to accusations of misconduct against the prominent lawyer Alan Dershowitz. Now he’s fighting to clear his name....
docs.abstract: Prominent criminal defense lawyer Alan M Dershowitz is in legal struggle to clear his name after defending his friend Jeffrey E Epstein in sexual misconduct case; faces fallout from suit by Virginia Roberts Giuffre, who accuses him of having sex with her while she was underage.

headline.main: Alan Dershowitz on the Defense (His Own)

docs.lead_paragraph: For Bernie Sanders, victory in Iowa's kickoff presidential caucuses hinges on a simple proposition: that his message of political revolution will inspire people who typically stay home on that deep-winter night.
docs.snippet: For Bernie Sanders, victory in Iowa's kickoff presidential caucuses hinges on a simple proposition: that his message of political revolution will inspire people who typically stay home on that deep-winter night....

headline.print_headline: Sanders' Iowa Supporters Try to Get New People Out to Caucus
